[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: BigQueryRow] [Flatten Injection] Does the `#[serde(flatten)]` attribute on `event_identity` properly prevent key collisions, or can an attacker craft EventIdentity with keys that overwrite other BigQueryRow fields? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: BigQueryRow] [Serialization Inconsistency] Can differences in JSON serialization between Rust serde and BigQuery's parser cause data corruption or loss of information during ingestion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: BigQueryRow] [PeerId Leakage] Does the flattened `event_identity` containing PeerId expose sensitive validator identity information that could enable targeted attacks on specific validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-telemetry-service/src/types/telemetry.rs] [Struct: BigQueryRow] [ChainId Confusion] Can an attacker submit telemetry with mismatched ChainId values in EventIdentity, causing cross-chain metric pollution or incorrect network analytics? (Low)
